titleStmt.title: Anglia rediviva Englands recovery being the history of the motions, actions, and successes of the army under the immediate conduct of His Excellency Sr. Thomas Fairfax, Kt., Captain-General of all the Parliaments forces in England / compiled for the publique good by Ioshua Sprigge ...
titleStmt.author: Sprigg, Joshua, 1618-1684.
Fiennes, Nathaniel, 1607 or 8-1669.

biblFull.extent: [21], 335 [i.e. 331], [4] p., 2 folded leaves of plates : ill., coat of arms

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by R.W. for Iohn Partridge ...,

notesStmt.note: Clement Walker, in his History of independency, p. 32, states that Col. Nathaniel Fiennes is the real author of this work, but "his assumption is not supported on any evidence. It is probably based on the fact that Anglia rediviva justified the conduct of Fiennes in surrendering Bristol in 1643." Cf. DNB.
Reproduction of original in Union Theological Seminary Library, New York.
